edu.biu.scapi.primitives.trapdoorPermutation
Class TrapdoorPermutationAbs

java.lang.Object
  edu.biu.scapi.primitives.trapdoorPermutation.TrapdoorPermutationAbs
All Implemented Interfaces:
TrapdoorPermutation
Direct Known Subclasses:
CryptoPpRabinPermutation, CryptoPpRSAPermutation, OpenSSLRSAPermutation, ScRSAPermutation
public abstract class TrapdoorPermutationAbs
extends java.lang.Object
implements TrapdoorPermutation

This class implements some common functionality of trapdoor permutation.

Author:
Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

setKey

public void setKey(java.security.PublicKey publicKey)
            throws java.security.InvalidKeyException
Description copied from interface: TrapdoorPermutation
Sets this trapdoor permutation with a public key

After this initialization, this object can do compute but not invert. This initialization is for user that wants to encrypt a message using the public key but deosn't want to decrypt a message.

Specified by:
setKey in interface TrapdoorPermutation
Throws:
java.security.InvalidKeyException

isKeySet

public boolean isKeySet()
Description copied from interface: TrapdoorPermutation
Checks if this trapdoor permutation object has been previously initialized.

To initialize the object the setKey function has to be called with corresponding parameters after construction.

Specified by:
isKeySet in interface TrapdoorPermutation
Returns:
true if the object was initialized;

false otherwise.

hardCorePredicate

public byte hardCorePredicate(TPElement tpEl)
Compute the hard core predicate of the given tpElement, by return the least significant bit of the element.

Specified by:
hardCorePredicate in interface TrapdoorPermutation
Parameters:
tpEl - the element to compute the hard core predicate on
Returns:
byte the hard core predicate. In java, the smallest types are boolean and byte. We chose to return a byte since many times we need to concatenate the result of various predicates and it will be easier with a byte than with a boolean.

hardCoreFunction

public byte[] hardCoreFunction(TPElement tpEl)
Computes the hard core function of the given tpElement, by return the log (N) least significant bits of the element.

Specified by:
hardCoreFunction in interface TrapdoorPermutation

Returns:
